conclusion: Mechanical energy loss during collision is difference between initial kinetic energy of C and final kinetic energy of system (C and B).
Initial kinetic energy of C is (1/2)mv_0^2.
Using conservation of momentum, common velocity v after collision is v_0/2.
Final kinetic energy of system (C and B) is (1/2)mv_0^2.
Mechanical energy loss during collision is 0.
